intro: Siphocampylus coleoides, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant produces violet-colored berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Its leaves are broad and oval, with a slightly hairy texture. Siphocampylus coleoides is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
